image.altText: People gathered around the LEGO City.

props.synopsis: An 80 per cent dropout rate, compliance concerns, and a LEGO city sold as a "highlight" — this multimillion-dollar cybersecurity initiative has been labelled a "patch job".

title.children: 'A show pony': New cybersecurity course had 80pc dropout rate

image.altText: A bulldozer moves black material at a processing facility surrounded by conveyors, large buildings, and chimneys.

props.synopsis: As a pause in production at troubled smelter Liberty Bell Bay stretches on, speculation about its future builds after a series of meetings between a US private credit provider and Tasmania's industry minister.

title.children: Liberty Bell Bay future in spotlight as speculation over takeover bid builds

image.altText: Bridge safety barrier design concept art.

props.synopsis: Plans to widen the pedestrian and cycling pathways on Hobart's Tasman Bridge were scrapped last year, but improved safety barriers and passing bays will go ahead.

title.children: Upgraded Tasman Bridge barrier designs released, after coroner found 'immediate need'

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The operator of Tasmania's ferry fleet told the state-owned operator of ports, "They're our ships, we know what we're doing", before botching design specifications, an inquiry has heard.

title.children: 'We know what we're doing': Ferry operator doubled down before $9m blunder

image.altText: A close-up of a locked gate inside a prison.

props.synopsis: A female Aboriginal prisoner has died in custody after a "serious medical episode", Tasmania's director of prisons has confirmed.

title.children: Female Aboriginal prisoner dies in custody in Tasmania

image.altText: Peter George and Craig Garland outside parliament following a meeting with Labor 2025-08-07 10:08:00

props.synopsis: A strong critic of Tasmania's salmon industry says the Liberal government has "ambushed" those who supported it to remain in power.

title.children: Rockliff will 'rue the day', Peter George says, amid anger over salmon study

image.altText: A woman wearing a suit smiles and waves.

props.synopsis: Former US vice-president Kamala Harris is contemplating another run for the presidency and says she was "reckless" to have not stopped Joe Biden from pursuing a second term.

title.children: 'It was reckless': Kamala Harris's major election regret

image.altText: A middle aged white man with white hair looking in the mirror, folding his lips back to reveal broken teeth

props.synopsis: A 12-fold increase in Australians raiding their retirement nest eggs to fund expensive dental treatments in recent years has been labelled a "systemic failure".

title.children: Jon has been left with metal posts instead of teeth and $40k less super

image.altText: Murray Watt

props.synopsis: Murray Watt warns the Coalition and Greens not to "obstruct" environment laws being introduced to parliament on Thursday, while assuring a special power in the bill would not allow him to intervene on behalf of coal or gas projects.

title.children: Watt fires warning shot at Ley on environment laws

image.altText: grey stacks of a factory in a rural outback setting

props.synopsis: A leading Australian expert in mining safety says the investigation into a fatal explosion at a western New South Wales mine could take a long time because "mining is getting more complex".

title.children: 'Dark days ahead' as experts predict lengthy probe into fatal mine blast

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force will now refer to all sexual or sexual-related offences as "violence" rather than "misconduct".

title.children: Australian Defence Force quietly changes definition of sexual-related offences

image.altText: White cruise ship on water with island in background.

props.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority will speak with the crew of a cruise ship that allegedly left behind an 80-year-old Australian woman, who was later found dead on a Queensland tropical island.

title.children: Safety authority investigates how cruise ship left woman's body on island

image.altText: Illustration of car and home with rooftop solar.

props.synopsis: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicles are sweeping the Australian market. Exclusive modelling suggests the "low-emission" sales boom may actually delay emissions reductions.

title.children: Why plug-in hybrid cars can be almost as polluting as petrol cars

image.altText: Tony Burke at press conference

props.synopsis: Human rights groups and politicians say a deal between Nauru and Australia aimed at sending hundreds of former detainees to the Pacific island is "shrouded in secrecy".

title.children: Government blasted over 'secrecy' after first NZYQ deportation to Nauru

image.altText: Krissy Barrett

props.synopsis: In an address to the National Press Club on Wednesday, new AFP Commissioner Krissy Barrett will announce the new taskforce and flag a desire to recast the agency as a national security agency.

title.children: AFP to target men 'hunting' young girls, coercing them to commit violent acts

image.altText: A woman on a sitcom show

props.synopsis: British actress Prunella Scales, best known for playing Sybil Fawlty in beloved sitcom Fawlty Towers, has died age 93.

title.children: Fawlty Towers actress Prunella Scales dies age 93

image.altText: Cash money in a purse with a calculator, tea towel, list of bills on a notepad and a pen

props.synopsis: If the September quarter consumer price index comes in higher than expected, it could postpone home loan relief for borrowers and create a dilemma for the RBA.

title.children: Millions of mortgage borrowers sweating on a single number

image.altText: An aerial shot of a small archipelago of islands surrounded by water.

props.synopsis: One the Pacific's most high-profile leaders is pressing Anthony Albanese to fly to the global UN climate summit in Brazil next month to "close the deal" with Türkiye and secure COP31 hosting rights for next year.

title.children: Pacific leader pushing Australia to 'close the deal' on hosting COP31

image.altText: A dejected Matildas player puts her head down as she walks off the pitch with the referee holding up a red card.

props.synopsis: The Matildas were criticised for playing at "walking pace" as two-time European champions England dominate at Derby's Pride Park.

title.children: 'Walking pace' Matildas fall to disappointing defeat against England

image.altText: close up sign of Optus

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the telco's triple-0 failure was green-lit by the Senate late on Tuesday and will hold its first hearings in Parliament House next week.

title.children: Optus to be called before senators to explain triple-0 failure

image.altText: The recently constructed Kurilpa Building on the Brisbane State High campus

props.synopsis: The state's education minister has ordered an investigation into the blunder, which was initially believed to affect one school, before that number grew.

title.children: At least eight Queensland state high schools taught wrong topic for year 12 exam

image.altText: A woman in a lab coat and safety glasses extracting a sample from a test tube.

props.synopsis: A study using mice has found high exposure to PFAS lowered the male's sperm count, decreased testosterone and disrupted embryo development.

title.children: High PFAS exposure could impact male fertility, study finds

image.altText: An onshore gas facility, as viewed from across the harbour.

props.synopsis: An oil spill that leaked into Darwin Harbour and the substantial under-reporting of toxic emissions have put one of Australia's biggest gas companies under federal investigation.

title.children: Oil spill, emissions error trigger gas giant federal investigation

image.altText: A doctor speaks with a patient at a desk.

props.synopsis: Australians with oral cancer are being left tens of thousands of dollars out of pocket to cover dental prosthetics because of a gap in funding.

title.children: Doctors 'ashamed' of healthcare system that is victimising these patients

image.altText: A yellow street sign with the words 'Stirling Tce' written on it.

props.synopsis: The WA governor's apology for the Pinjarra Massacre sparks fresh debate over the renaming of roads and places that honour the state's first governor, James Stirling.

title.children: Massacre apology prompts debate over Stirling name across WA

image.altText: Man in suit and tie

props.synopsis: The Queensland health minister has issued a new directive to ban public doctors from prescribing puberty blockers to youths six hours after a Supreme Court overturned the January freeze.

title.children: Snap new Queensland ban on puberty blockers for transgender adolescents

image.altText: A person at a desk with a calculator and lots of receipts in their hand.

props.synopsis: Time is running out if you are planning on doing your 2024–25 tax return yourself. Here is everything you need to know.

title.children: Have you done your tax return yet? The deadline ends soon

image.altText: Birds eye view of Lake Boga.

props.synopsis: Blue-green algae levels at Lake Boga in Victoria's north-west are three times the safe limit.

title.children: Fears high algae levels will make Victorian lake off limits this summer

image.altText: Two cranes constructing a big hospital project behind a road

props.synopsis: The South Australian government's three costliest hospital projects have all had "delays in starting construction", according to the auditor-general — but the health minister says they remain on schedule.

title.children: SA's three biggest hospital projects delayed, auditor-general says

image.altText: A young Sudanese child looking at the camera with a bandage around their head.

props.synopsis: Sudanese paramilitary forces are accused of having "executed more than 2,000 unarmed civilians" since taking control of the western city of El-Fasher, as alarming reports of atrocities emerge.

title.children: Sudan paramilitary group accused of killing 2,000 civilians in El-Fasher

image.altText: An Indian fielder grimaces as he holds the ball in one hand on the ground in an ODI against Australia.

props.synopsis: The Indian team confirms Shreyas Iyer is on the mend after a freak injury left him in hospital with a lacerated spleen in an incident during his side's ODI win over Australia.

title.children: India's Shreyas Iyer recovering with lacerated spleen from Australian ODI

image.altText: Dry farmland beneath a mostly clear sky.

props.synopsis: The Federation of Victorian Traditional Owner Corporations calls for a pause on mining approvals until a formal benefit-sharing agreement is in place.

title.children: Traditional owner group calls for a pause on Victorian mining approvals

image.altText: A woman holding up a sign reading "act now or swim later"

props.synopsis: A report from the UN's climate change body shows global carbon emissions appear to be on track to fall by 10 per cent by 2035, far short of its 60 per cent target.

title.children: 'Serious need for speed' in global climate commitments amid 2035 target shortfalls

image.altText: A close-up shot of a man.

props.synopsis: Billionaire Elon Musk has launched a new AI-generated site to compete with online encyclopedia Wikipedia, which he has accused of being "extremely left-biased".

title.children: Elon Musk launches new AI-generated site to rival 'left-biased' Wikipedia

image.altText: Woman plays violin as cars drive past

props.synopsis: Busking may be a familiar sight on Sydney's George Street, but most key spots for musicians have now been banned.

title.children: Sydney musicians left feeling voiceless after CBD busking crackdown
